page.title: 20FARMING AROUND GREENSIDE
page.content: The area around Greenside is mainly a farming area. It is quite close to Tyneside so many farmers keep some dairu cattle to sell their milk. Most of the milk from the farms around here goes to the creamery at Blaydon. This means that quite a large area of farmland is used for pasture or for growing hay which is fed to the nimals in winter. The farmers also keep beef cattle and sheep to sell at the local markets of Newcastle, Hexham and Ponteland. During the winter the farmers also use the hay they have grown to feed these animals. The main crop grown in this area is barley, which is usually the winter variety.
